title: Man arrested in connection with 2013 house party murders
content:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. (KBAK/KBFX) - For two years, Eyewitness News has followed a story about two young men who were killed in east Bakersfield.
Jose Garcia III, 20, and Feliberto Ponce, 17, were gunned down on Columbus Street at a house party on May 26, 2013.
Two others were shot and injured, but survived.
The suspected shooter, Julio Jesus Romero, has been on the run since, but the Bakersfield Police Department confirmed Romero was captured Saturday in Sinaloa, Mexico.
Family members called Eyewitness News Sunday evening after finding out about Romero's arrest.
"They told me they got him up in Mexico. He's been apprehended," said Manuel Garcia, Jose Garcia's grandfather. "I don't know how, but he's extradited to here."
Family members say they received the call from the detective on the case Sunday evening.
The family members say they're thankful for the hard work it took to capture Romero.
"I want to thank them so much, the Marines, detectives, Marshals, they did so much for us, how they went out there and got all these people involved, just for justice for my little brother," said Isaias Ponce, the older brother of Feliberto Ponce.
"I'm at peace now," said an emotional Manuel Garcia. "I don't have to worry about someone running loose and harming someone else's child."
Romero was transported to Bakersfield on Sunday and booked into the Kern County Jail for two counts of murder, and two counts of attempted murder.
